fields.headline: What's new?
fields.bodyText: Ryanair coach class Ryanair (ryanair.com) passengers can now buy cheap coach transfers to take them from the airline's out-of-town airports into the city centres. The service is available from £9 return with Terravision, and runs from Rome Ciampino, Milan Bergamo, and from the Galileo Galilei airport near Pisa to Florence. Cabins in store MyTravel has launched a new cruise service, the Cruise Store allowing customers to book with top cruise operators online, by phone or in a store (0870 191 3705; thecruisestore.co.uk). Sun, sea and ethics Tips on how to be an ethical tourist are offered in a new book, The Rough Guide to a Better World, published in association with the Department for International Development. The book is available free from all branches of the Post Office, or can be downloaded from roughguide-betterworld.com. Word's our bond Members of the Association of British Travel Agents, including tour operators Thomas Cook, Thomson Holidays, First Choice and MyTravel, will have to inform customers about whether they are financially bonded or not when they buy any of their products. At the moment, it is possible for Abta members to sell holiday products that are not protected, leaving cutomers at risk of financial loss should the company they booked with go bust. From January, they will have clearly to indicate bonded status in brochures and in person.
